response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round pans. In a medium bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, and ½ teaspoon salt. Set aside for the dry mix.",
  "step2": "In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 cup sugar, ½ cup melted butter, and 2 eggs. Beat on medium speed until pale and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and ½ cup milk. Pour this wet mixture over the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined.",
  "step3": "Fold in 1 cup boiling water slowly; batter will be thin. Spoon the batter evenly into the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap the pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles and level the batter for even baking.",
  "step4": "Bake in the preheated oven for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs. Remove from oven and let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.",
  "step5": "While cakes cool, whisk 1 cup powdered sugar, 4 tablespoons butter, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and 2–3 tablespoons milk until smooth. Adjust consistency by adding more milk or powdered sugar. Chill frosting in the fridge for 10 minutes to firm up slightly.",
  "step6": "Once cakes are cool, level tops with a knife if uneven. Place one layer on a cake plate, spread a thin layer of frosting, top with the second layer, and apply a crumb coat. Chill for 10 minutes, then finish with a generous swirl of frosting and chocolate shavings for a decadent finish."
}
```
